univariate¶

Title:Univariate Linear Regression.

@author: Bhishan Poudel

@date: Sep 22, 2017

@email: bhishanpdl@gmail.com

The cost function is given by

Minimizing the cost function w.r.t. w gives two system of liner equations:

We solve these normal equations and find the values w0 and w1.

univariate.compute_cost(X, t, w)[source]¶

Compute objective function on dataset (X, t).

univariate.compute_rmse(X, t, w)[source]¶

Compute RMSE on dataset (X, t).

Note: cost function J is 1/2 of mean squared error. RMSE is square root of mean squared error.

univariate.main()[source]¶

Run main function.

univariate.myplot(fh_train, fh_test, w)[source]¶
univariate.read_data(infile)[source]¶

Read the datafile and return arrays

univariate.train(X, t)[source]¶

Implement univariate linear regression to compute w = [w0, w1].

I solve system of linear equations from lecture 01

w0 N + w1 sum_x = sum_t

w0 sum_x + w1 sum_xx = sum_tx

univariate.univariate_reg(fh_train, fh_test)[source]¶
